attributes.action: Put policies and money in place to make the uk Carbon Zero by 2050
attributes.additional_details:
The Committee on Climate Change believes that achieving zero emissions depends on low-carbon technologies, industry, and the public sharing the impact.
It estimates that about 38% of the change can be achieved through low-carbon technologies, 9% would depend mainly on societal or behavioural changes alone, and 53% would depend on a combination of both.
attributes.background: The United Nations says we could have just 12 years left to limit a climate change catastrophe. The national government needs to declare an emergency and put resources in place to enable councils to help reduce carbon emissions.
